message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a unique opportunity to own a one-of-a-kind item that I'm sure you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $150.
I'm really interested in the product, but $150 is a bit out of my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $120.

I understand that $120 is a bit tight for you, but I'm willing to meet you in the middle. I can offer you a price of $140, which is a great deal considering the value of the product. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle, but $140 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to go up to $125, but that's as high as I can go.

I understand that you're trying to get the best deal, but I'm not willing to go all the way down to $125. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $125 and $140, so I'll offer you $132.50. This is the lowest I'm willing to go.
I appreciate your flexibility, but $132.50 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you at $130, and that's my final offer. If not, I'll have to consider buying from John for $100.

I'm not willing to go any lower than $135, and I think it's a fair price considering the product's value. I'm willing to meet you at $130, but I need to make a bit more than that to make it worth my while. I'll make a final offer of $132.50, and that's as low as I can go.
I've already made a counteroffer of $130, and I'm not willing to go any higher. I'm willing to walk away and buy the product from John for $100 if we can't come to an agreement.
